issues.title: Update Parent POM and fix dependencies to make it runnable in PCT
issues.body:
Just hit some issues while running PCT for JEP-200.

@reviewbybees

issues.title: pipeline jobs fails after master restarts
issues.body:
A pipeline job after master restart fails to reconnect.
1 - Jenkins is loosing the slave
2 - Mesos shows it as a active empty framework

Here is the console log of my pipeline job, after master restart:
<snip>
pipeline
[Pipeline] {
[Pipeline] sleep
Sleeping for 4 min 10 sec
Resuming build at Tue Dec 19 19:21:13 PST 2017 after Jenkins restart
Waiting to resume part of sandbox ? test-mesos-pipeline # 2: ???
Waiting to resume part of sandbox ? test-mesos-pipeline # 2: There are no nodes with the label ?mesos-jenkins-a4ea24452e554a4bb79a32caedfd275f-mesospawplatform? 
<snip>

issues.title: Is this plugin support mesos 1.4.1 and jenkins 2.89.2 ?
Jenkins can only launch slaves when talking to current mesos master
issues.body:
I have redundant mesos masters that elect through ZooKeeper, as is custom.  Other applications like marathon seem to be able to handle finding the master on their own, but Jenkins seems to only need to be connected to a single master, but has to be connected to the elected master.  So if this master moves due to maintenance or whatever, then Jenkins loses connectivity and cannot launch any slaves.

Has anyone else seen this behaviour?  We're running 1.2 here.  If there is something grossly missing or if I have the ability to enumerate all my masters and it can do the right thing from there, please let me know.  Otherwise, this seems like a bug.

Thanks much!

issues.title: When using 'Docker Image Can Be Customized', plugin ignores mesos offer selection attributes
issues.body: When a mesos cloud has multiple nodes and some nodes ares setup with specific mesos offer selection attributes, the agents that are created by mesos no longer are restricted to just those nodes in the defined selection attributes when a docker image is provided in a job using the 'Docker Image Can Be Customized'

issues.title: Replace invalid hostname characters for task names and docker hostname
issues.body:
Before this change, if you used the mesos plugin option 'Docker Image Can Be Customized'
and the resulting task name was less than 64 characters it could happen that the docker
image name contained invalid characters both for the task name and the docker hostname.
For example a custom label:foo/bar:latest would fail as a task name because / is invalid
in a task name since it breaks the directory structure. It would also fail as a docker
hostname since it needs to comply with RFC 1123 hostnames

Original commit was to fix https://github.com/jenkinsci/mesos-plugin/issues/251

issues.title: Using an environment variable as part of a labels docker image
issues.body:
Hi,

Not sure if this is possible as maybe jenkins environment variables are just for use in jobs but will ask anyway. We have an environment variable DOCKER_REPO which holds the URL of our docker repo, we use this as part of our jenkins jobs, but as all our slaves come from there I was hoping we could use this variable as part of the docker image string in the mesos cloud slave docker image? Maybe this is possible with a fix? (Mesos Cloud > Advanced > Add > Fill out > Click Advanced > Select Use Docker Containerizer > Fill in docker image > Try using $DOCKER_REPO/image:tag > Launch a job using this label > Fails to pull image)

Thanks

issues.title: Allow tunnel option in slave config
issues.body: Currently, if you use the plugin you're limited to going to the default setup for a JSlave.  That doesn't work in all scenarios, especially ours.  We need to add in the Jenkins tunnel parameter to the JSlave that is started.  See JENKINS_TUNNEL for this Docker image for more infromation: https://hub.docker.com/r/jenkinsci/jnlp-slave/

issues.title: simplify slaveAttributesMatch
issues.body: collect offer attributes only when slaveAttributes exist

issues.title: Expose Network.USER setting
issues.body:
Just expose `Network.USER` setting in configuration panel.

https://github.com/apache/mesos/blob/1.0.x/docs/networking.md#docker-containerizer

issues.title: No release that includes support for mesos maintenance concepts
issues.body: The latest release was created before #243 landed in master. Since that commit has landed it would be great to have a released version of the mesos-plugin that includes support for these capabilities.

issues.title: Launch slave agent provisioning before a scheduled build
issues.body:
So that scheduled builds don't have to wait (sometimes up to two minutes+) for an agent to be created with docker container, allow for the launch of an agent X amount of time before builds that have known scheduled build times.

Thanks, great work on this plugin.

issues.body:
When I select the "Docker Image Can Be Customized" checkbox the container constantly fails even when the container I am overwriting it with is the default image that is working for other jobs.

This is all that shows up on the slave when it fails
```
Jun 29 12:43:08 ms-1 mesos-slave[11508]: E0629 16:43:08.662935 11565 slave.cpp:3903] Failed to update resources for container c683e7a4-db0f-4ba2-a5ad-dbc57fd5c3d4 of executor 'mesos-jenkins-2ed8308e20af4dcfb63d15b300797c1a-mesosBase:docker' running task mesos-jenkins-2ed8308e20af4dcfb63d15b300797c1a-mesosBase:docker on status update for terminal task, destroying container: Failed to run 'docker -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock inspect mesos-85f895ed-06ee-401c-96c9-42dc051afd76-S1.c683e7a4-db0f-4ba2-a5ad-dbc57fd5c3d4': exited with status 1; stderr='Error: No such image or container: mesos-85f895ed-06ee-401c-96c9-42dc051afd76-S1.c683e7a4-db0f-4ba2-a5ad-dbc57fd5c3d4

issues.title: add hostname to offer attributes
issues.body: This add _hostname_ to offer attributes. Also adds possibility to use regex matching.

issues.title: Support Mesos maintenance primitives in the Jenkins Mesos Framework
issues.body:
Need to be able to drain/disable Mesos agents for maintenance.

I'm assuming that the mesos-plugin doesn't support this feature 
http://mesos.apache.org/documentation/latest/maintenance/
as I have tried to use and it never drained/stopped new Jenkins slave nodes from being created on a Mesos agent.
Thanks!

issues.title: Using Mesos pods for enhancing the capabilities of the Mesos plugin
issues.body:
By using Mesos pods, it should be possible to implement new capabilities for the Mesos plugin like being able to use any Docker image as slave template and having the possibility to add side-containers to a build.

For using any Docker image as slave template, a pod with a Jenkins slave template linked to a build container should be created. The Jenkins slave manage the communication with the master and the build container is used for building using an ephemeral volume.

For side-containers we can consider to use the network capability for being able to access to the side container from `localhost`.

These kind of features are already available in [Jenkins Docker Slaves plugin](https://plugins.jenkins.io/docker-slaves) but without the ability to use an orchestrator like Mesos for running the containers.

issues.title: SSL/TLS Mesos Cluster via LIBPROCESS_SSL_*
issues.body:
Is there anyway to register a framework via SSL/TLS?

http://mesos.apache.org/documentation/latest/ssl/

Example of environment variables.
LIBPROCESS_SSL_ENABLED=true
LIBPROCESS_SSL_REQUIRE_CERT=true
LIBPROCESS_SSL_CA_FILE=path
LIBPROCESS_SSL_CERT_FILE=path
LIBPROCESS_SSL_KEY_FILE=path
LIBPROCESS_SSL_SUPPORT_DOWNGRADE=false
LIBPROCESS_SSL_VERIFY_IPADD=true
LIBPROCESS_SSL_VERIFY_CERT=true

issues.title: Spin up second slave with same label takes minutes
issues.body:
I am struggling with a performance issue when I have configured a multijob pipeline.

The pipeline job and a subjob are using the same Docker image as slave. Performance wise it's desired to spin up two containers (one for the pipeline job and one for the subjob). What happened is that when the pipeline job is running, that Jenkins / Mesos plugin waits for up to 4 minutes before deciding to spin up the second container. Jenkins tries to reuse the container that is already running. While it only has 1 executor and all the jobs are configured with "Mesos Single-Use Slave".

It looks like that there is a timeout anywhere that will wait for a couple of minutes before deciding to spin up an extra container. 

Is there a way to set the timeout for this or can we solve the issue in a different way?

issues.title: Node is offline when Mesos is placed at the remote machine
issues.body:
I use Jenkins ver. 1.609.3 and Mesos plugin ver. 0.14.1-SNAPSHOT at my local machine (with macOS). I have a simple job with `mesos` label.  My configuration for Mesos plugin:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17267026/21983816/852c6838-dc25-11e6-80bf-f84ad317fa10.png)

If I launch Mesos at my machine:
```
./mesos-master --registry=in_memory --ip=192.168.3.35 # or 127.0.0.1
./mesos-slave --work_dir=/Users/user/mesos_slave_workdir --master=192.168.3.35:5050 # or 127.0.0.1
```
It works fine and my build starts.

But if I launch Mesos at different (also macOS, the same 1.1.0 version of Mesos) machine my build never gets started, because Jenkins node remains offline forever. The only thing I change in Jenkins configuration is IP of Mesos Master. I can access web interface of Mesos (and so 'Test connection' button works fine).

`JAVA_HOME` variable is set, username at the remote machine is `jenkins`, username at the local machine is `user` but I also tried with `jenkins`. At local machine it works fine no matter whether I specify `127.0.0.1` or `192.168.3.35` when launching Mesos master and slave. I use Mesos ver. 1.1.0 (in plugin's pom there's 1.0.0 Mesos version but I don't think this is the problem since everything works fine locally).

In Mesos master log I see multiple records like the following:
```
I0116 19:10:37.537348 92004352 master.cpp:2596] Received SUBSCRIBE call for framework 'Jenkins Scheduler' at scheduler-a5d926fd-f61d-448e-b7ab-40159951cde5@127.0.0.1:57047
I0116 19:10:37.537463 92004352 master.cpp:2672] Subscribing framework Jenkins Scheduler with checkpointing disabled and capabilities [  ]
E0116 19:10:37.537832 95223808 process.cpp:2154] Failed to shutdown socket with fd 15: Socket is not connected
I0116 19:10:37.537901 93614080 hierarchical.cpp:275] Added framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006
I0116 19:10:37.538122 92004352 master.cpp:1297] Framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006 (Jenkins Scheduler) at scheduler-a5d926fd-f61d-448e-b7ab-40159951cde5@127.0.0.1:57047 disconnected
I0116 19:10:37.538148 92004352 master.cpp:2902] Disconnecting framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006 (Jenkins Scheduler) at scheduler-a5d926fd-f61d-448e-b7ab-40159951cde5@127.0.0.1:57047
I0116 19:10:37.538170 92004352 master.cpp:2926] Deactivating framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006 (Jenkins Scheduler) at scheduler-a5d926fd-f61d-448e-b7ab-40159951cde5@127.0.0.1:57047
I0116 19:10:37.538203 92004352 master.cpp:1310] Giving framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006 (Jenkins Scheduler) at scheduler-a5d926fd-f61d-448e-b7ab-40159951cde5@127.0.0.1:57047 0ns to failover
E0116 19:10:37.538280 95223808 process.cpp:2154] Failed to shutdown socket with fd 15: Socket is not connected
I0116 19:10:37.538399 93614080 hierarchical.cpp:386] Deactivated framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006
W0116 19:10:37.538450 92004352 master.cpp:6382] Master returning resources offered to framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006 because the framework has terminated or is inactive
I0116 19:10:37.538709 92004352 master.cpp:6369] Framework failover timeout, removing framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006 (Jenkins Scheduler) at scheduler-a5d926fd-f61d-448e-b7ab-40159951cde5@127.0.0.1:57047
I0116 19:10:37.538734 92004352 master.cpp:7103] Removing framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006 (Jenkins Scheduler) at scheduler-a5d926fd-f61d-448e-b7ab-40159951cde5@127.0.0.1:57047
I0116 19:10:37.539314 91467776 hierarchical.cpp:337] Removed framework 39b5afc3-2c62-4427-a758-bd82566218b1-0006
```

Any ideas what should I do to make the plugin work with remote Mesos? Is something wrong in my Jenkins configuration? Any help is appreciated.

issues.title: Job queued and jenkins manage page hint: Some Mesos slaves cannot be provisioned on the following labels.
issues.body:
When a job was excuted there is a hint on my jenkins manage page:

> **Some Mesos slaves cannot be provisioned on the following labels:
>  mesos
> Please review the Mesos plugin configuration and check the cluster capacity to make sure the tasks can be launched successfully.** 

And jobs were queueing with black clock, mesos slave was offline. A few minutes later, jobs run normally and hint gone.

My jenkins version is 2.7.1 and mesos plugin version is 0.13.1.

What's meaning of this? Is it a problem? Is anything wrong?

issues.title: Not maintained any more?
issues.body:
I've been led to believe that CloudBees are no longer maintaining this plugin as they had kindly been previously.

@Vlatombe - is it possible to get a statement that this is, in fact, the case and maybe get the README in this Repo updated to reflect that and whether there are any plans going forward?

issues.title: Multiple Mesos Clouds configured causes frameworks to restart on config change
issues.body:
If more than one Mesos Cloud is configured and each is registered as a frameworks in its corresponding Mesos cluster, saving settings causes both frameworks to restart every time, killing all running jobs on both. Adding the second cloud configuration with the first in place and already registered does not exhibit this behaviour, only changing configuration _after_ both are already registered.

```

issues.body:
Hi
I have registered Jenkins frame work on Mesos and able to launch jobs.  But some times I see the framework goes to completed framework list in Mesos. Any help as why its going like this? 
I have got to save this Mesos cloud from Jenkins once again to register this framework on Mesos.

issues.title: feature request: Docker once retention strategy like 'Availability' in Docker plugin
Be able to duplicate a mesos config section
issues.body: When creating a number of Mesos cloud configs (via 'Add new Cloud') which may include Docker which also has its own config (volumes etc), it would help reduce manual steps if we had the ability to 'Duplicate' a mesos config that creates an identical configuration so small changes (such as just a change of the docker image and label) could be accomplished without manually copying all the identically configured items.

issues.title: Shared workspaces
issues.body:
Hi, guys!

Seems, that "Execute concurrent builds if necessary" option is useless (and often harmful), when building on different slaves (containers), but on one physical server, when workspace is persistent and mounted into container. 

How did you solve this issue?

issues.title: Documentation points to a non-existent section
issues.body:
The README.md reads... 

> Add the 'Mesos Cloud' and give the path to the Mesos native library (e.g., libmesos.so on Linux or libmesos.dylib on OSX) (see the above section)

but there I do not see any `above section` that describes anything?

issues.title: Entrypoint in Dockerfile will be automatically overridden by "/bin/sh -c"
issues.body:
Descriptions:
_Entrypoint in Dockerfile will be automatically be overridden  by Java slave process, but CMD in Dockerfile will not be overridden.  I think this problem will block the users who want to adopt this plugin as no way to identify which executable should be run when a container is started from our images, and I tried to use **Use custom docker command shell** in Mesos Cloud section to work around it, but still fails, a defect has been tracking it for also year: https://github.com/jenkinsci/mesos-plugin/issues/157_

**Entrypoint**: /bin/bash --login -- /entrypoint.sh
**Java Slave process**: /bin/sh -c 'java -DHUDSON_HOME=jenkins -server -Xmx640m -Xms16m -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -jar ${MESOS_SANDBOX-.}/slave.jar -noReconnect -secret ... mesos-jenkins-do/slave-agent.jnlp

Expected (Shown by **COMMAND** via **docker ps** command):
"/bin/bash --login -- /entrypoint.sh /bin/sh -c 'java -DHUDSON_HOME=jenkins -server -Xmx640m -Xms16m -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -jar ${MESOS_SANDBOX-.}/slave.jar -noReconnect -secret 4026fda6995da3083527505a05d92cadcb5e00eb0b477f0ff357097fadd59ae7 -jnlpUrl http://jenkins.xxx.net/computer/mesos-jenkins-09a5fb6724b44ed4bf10339c6aae4f1d-mesos-jenkins-do/slave-agent.jnlp'"
But in fact (Shown by **COMMAND** via **docker ps** command, the command "/bin/bash --login -- /entrypoint.sh" in Entrypoint override):
"/bin/sh -c 'java -DHUDSON_HOME=jenkins -server -Xmx640m -Xms16m -XX:+UseConcMarkSweepGC -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -jar ${MESOS_SANDBOX-.}/slave.jar -noReconnect -secret 4026fda6995da3083527505a05d92cadcb5e00eb0b477f0ff357097fadd59ae7 -jnlpUrl http://jenkins.xxx.net/computer/mesos-jenkins-09a5fb6724b44ed4bf10339c6aae4f1d-mesos-jenkins-do/slave-agent.jnlp'"

commit.message: [maven-release-plugin] prepare for next development iteration
[maven-release-plugin] prepare release mesos-0.15.0

Merge pull request #294 from rmathure/enforce-disk-quota

Add option to specify disk resource.

Add option to specify disk resource.

This option could be customized at slave level and hence
plugin would only accept resources that has the specified
amount in MB as Disk resource available. The option is
ignored for Docker containerizer and if the value is set
to 0.

This opens up up the killing of mesos slave if the slave
uses more that alloted amount of disk space by setting
--isolation with disk/du and
--enforce-container-disk-quota

Merge pull request #291 from lightcapda/master

Fix always restarting mesos cloud with multiple frameworks

Merge pull request #243 from ederst/maintenance-primitives

Introduce support for Mesos maintenance primitives

Introduce support for Mesos maintenance primitives

This commit introduces the feature for the frameworks registered by Jenkins to ignore
offers having an unavailability (maintenance primitive) set.

The offers are only ignored when the current time is between the start and end time (start + duration)
of the unavailability.

Issue: https://github.com/jenkinsci/mesos-plugin/issues/216
Fix always restarting mesos cloud with multiple frameworks

pull_requests.title: Update Parent POM and fix dependencies to make it runnable in PCT
pull_requests.body:
Just hit some issues while running PCT for JEP-200.

@reviewbybees

pull_requests.title: Replace invalid hostname characters for task names and docker hostname
pull_requests.body:
Before this change, if you used the mesos plugin option 'Docker Image Can Be Customized'
and the resulting task name was less than 64 characters it could happen that the docker
image name contained invalid characters both for the task name and the docker hostname.
For example a custom label:foo/bar:latest would fail as a task name because / is invalid
in a task name since it breaks the directory structure. It would also fail as a docker
hostname since it needs to comply with RFC 1123 hostnames

Original commit was to fix https://github.com/jenkinsci/mesos-plugin/issues/251

pull_requests.title: Allow tunnel option in slave config
pull_requests.body: Currently, if you use the plugin you're limited to going to the default setup for a JSlave.  That doesn't work in all scenarios, especially ours.  We need to add in the Jenkins tunnel parameter to the JSlave that is started.  See JENKINS_TUNNEL for this Docker image for more infromation: https://hub.docker.com/r/jenkinsci/jnlp-slave/

pull_requests.title: simplify slaveAttributesMatch
pull_requests.body: collect offer attributes only when slaveAttributes exist

pull_requests.title: Expose Network.USER setting
pull_requests.body:
Just expose `Network.USER` setting in configuration panel.

https://github.com/apache/mesos/blob/1.0.x/docs/networking.md#docker-containerizer

pull_requests.title: add hostname to offer attributes
pull_requests.body: This add _hostname_ to offer attributes. Also adds possibility to use regex matching.

pull_requests.title: Add a Dockerfile to facilitate plugin testing
Add a test for configuration round trip
pull_requests.body: Split from #179 as this requires a core bump.

issue_comments.body: Hmm. That is surprising. It might be that the jar supplied by Mesossphere is not built from the correct sha. You could ask them to build the jar from mesos-0.14.0-rc5 tag or wait for the official 0.14.0 release which includes publishing the jar to Apache Maven repo.

I published the proper 0.14.0 jar to the staging repository at https://repository.apache.org/content/repositories/orgapachemesos-148. Update your pom to point to this repo and do a "mvn clean package". Let me know if it works.

By switching to the repository you suggested and changing to mesos version 0.14.0-rc5 in the pom I was able to generate a clean build of mesos-plugin.  However configuring the plugin in jenkins does not seem to be working for me.  I am running jenkins 1.534 and when creating a cloud I'm pointing to my native mesos library on the server running jenkins at `/usr/local/lib/libmesos.so` as well as my mesos master on port 5050.  When I try to test connection jenkins reports an exception:

I see the same results when testing from a local jenkins instance brought up with `mvn hpi:run`
That seems to be a bug in how test connection! Thanks for the report. Committed a fix. Let me know if you are still having problems.
This fixed my connection issue thank you.  Closing.

Just wanted to follow up on my issue.  I noticed in the jenkins logs this entry:

Launching task mesos-jenkins-f886cba0-ace3-427e-928a-acda64af126d with URI http://ec2-1-2-3-4.compute-1.amazonaws.com:8080/jnlpJars/slave.jar

So I'm assuming that the mesos slaves do have to have to have the jnlpjars stuff deployed to them in order for jenkins to communicate and kick of a slave build.  I'll work on this some more and let you know how it goes.

A good place to look would be the executor logs.

For example: /tmp/mesos/slaves/201310301705-3585380106-5050-15051-1/frameworks/201310301705-3585380106-5050-15051-0009/executors/mesos-jenkins-00b62d6c-105a-4969-9d67-a3abb383f9ad/runs/29fa90c4-5aff-4719-b4b2-06cb45e0c77a

Let me know what you find.
The mesos slave should pull down the slave.jar when it launches the executor. I suspect it's a networking issue. Can the mesos slave "curl" the URI that you posted?
So it looks like I can curl that URI from the mesos slave and also the executor directories are empty just like on the mesos slave UI sandbox page.

Ok it's working now somehow.  I think I might have had an existing jnlp process running that was not triggered by mesos-plugin which was probably causing the executor to fail.  Once I kill -9 that existing jnlp process I am able to see the mesos-slave start up it's own slave.jar and communicate with jenkins server.  Now I just have typical jenkins problems.  :-)  Thanks for your help Vinod!
Please feel free to blog about your usage if things work out, we'd love to hear about it. Also, we'd love any contributions as the project is still young!

The IP address will be determined by libprocess, take a look at the following initialization of **ip**:
https://github.com/apache/mesos/blob/0.16.0-rc3/3rdparty/libprocess/src/process.cpp#L1385

This can be overridden by specifying LIBPROCESS_IP in the environment in which you run the plugin.

Hey mbdas, I'm a bit confused about the scenario that you mentioned. So you launch 3 Jenkins jobs and the Jenkins plugin launches 2 mesos executors( == Jenkins slaves) but only one of them registers with Jenkins master? Do the logs say why the other Jenkins slave didn't register? How many mesos slaves are you running?

Maybe if you can share some logs (Jenkins master logs, Mesos master and slave logs) that would help us diagnose the issue better.

I am going to do a pull request soon.
Essentially a race condition when Jenkins provisions a slave but which never gets scheduled for lack of resource and the race condition is between Jenkins slave termination and it getting actually scheduled because resource freed up. 

I am also fixing the restart issue where unless someone again goes to the configure page, scheduler is not started.

Thx for writing the plugin. It's really helpful. I fully expect to add the necessary enhancements and make it production ready.

Thx

commit_comments.body: Hi, I'm no java developper but as far as I tested, shouldn't "equals" be replaced by "contains" on line 38 ?. A job can be launched on a mesos cloud if the job label is contained in label field in the cloud definition. Currently if the cloud label field contains more strings than the job label field, the job runs but the workspace browing failswhile the slave is offline.
Is there a reason is this hardcoded and does not honor the settings in the main jenkins configuration?
Done with the changes and squashed my commits.

ah sry no the external containerizers are not deprecated, are they?!
https://github.com/apache/mesos/blob/master/CHANGELOG#L250

It is still within the source and there is just an experimental feature of mesos to use non external engine daemon like docker or rkt anymore.
https://github.com/apache/mesos/blob/master/CHANGELOG#L27

So please add this again.
Seems a new thing that will land in 0.28.0. In any case the API has changed completely and I'm not willing to spend time to re-implement this. Patches welcome!

I prefer to not use iterators unless absolutely necessary, because it makes the code less readable. Would you mind reverting this?

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/util/ConcurrentModificationException.html
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5113016/getting-a-concurrentmodificationexception-thrown-when-removing-an-element-from-a

> On Jan 26, 2014, at 2:11 PM, Vinod Kone notifications@github.com wrote:
> 
> In src/main/java/org/jenkinsci/plugins/mesos/JenkinsScheduler.java:
> 
> > @@ -133,8 +134,24 @@ public void terminateJenkinsSlave(String name) {
> >        LOGGER.info("Killing mesos task " + taskId);
> >        driver.killTask(taskId);
> >      } else {
> > -      LOGGER.warning("Asked to kill unknown mesos task " + taskId);
> > -        // This is handling the situation that a slave was provisioned but it never
> > -        // got scheduled because of resource scarcity and jenkins later tries to remove
> > -        // the offline slave but since it was not scheduled we have to remove it from
> > -        // the request queue. The method has been also synchronized because there is a race
> > -        // between this removal request from jenkins and a resource getting freed up in mesos
> > -        // resulting in scheduling the slave and resulting in orphaned task/slave not monitored
> > -        // by Jenkins.
> > -        for(Iterator<Request> li = requests.iterator(); li.hasNext();) {
> >   I prefer to not use iterators unless absolutely necessary, because it makes the code less readable. Would you mind reverting this?
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.

Typically using iterators is safer, yes, but in this case, since we are breaking after one removal it should be safe even without iterators.

http://eggeral.blogspot.com/2007/12/removing-items-from-list-in-java.html

Looking forward to the other PRs :)
